author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 20
text:
Number of the day 
105 percent 
That’s how much Weight Watchers International stock went up Monday, a testament to the power of Oprah Winfrey . She is paying about $43.3 million for a 10 percent stake in the company and joining its board, and already has made back most of her investment — at least on paper, which is reportedly very low in calories.
Huh? 
And the winner in the war of words between the Goliath New York Times and the even-more-Goliath Amazon.com is ... a San Francisco tech startup? Could well be. When an Amazon executive wrote a rebuttal to an Aug. 15 Times story about Amazon’s tough workplace, and a Times editor wrote a rebuttal , and the Amazon exec rebutted the rebuttal , the exchange didn’t take place in the pages of the Times, but on Medium , a website that has established itself as a forum for tech leaders to publish anything from mission statements to mea culpas.
The future 2.0 
The tech world is getting its geek on as it readies for Back to the Future Day on Wednesday — Oct. 21, 2015, is the date Marty McFly ( Michael J. Fox ) transported to in 1989’s “Back to the Future Part II.” As Time reported , there is an interactive profile of Doc Brown on Facebook , which also has a Back to the Future Day page . Need more? How about a wiki that shows the timeline , and a countdown clock for those who can’t do the math. 
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
